summary:
## The Ojibwe People

The Ojibwe are a large Indigenous group originally from the Great Lakes region and northern plains. They are one of the biggest Native American tribes in the U.S. and the second-largest First Nations group in Canada.

They are known for their birchbark canoes, wild rice harvesting, and the Midewiwin Society, which preserves important knowledge in birchbark scrolls.

Ojibwe land was taken over by European settlers, and they signed treaties to get compensation and reserved land.
title: Ojibwe
